summary: Allows you to smelt down most generic none enchanted armor, weapons, arrows, clutter and dwarven items in Skyrim into ingots.
descriptionHtml:
This mod takes what derangedhk417 was doing with Item Recycling and continues it.

Almost all generic none enchanted armor, weapons, arrows, clutter and dwarven items can be melted down into ingots of the matching material, IE iron sword = iron ingot etc. Just like Item Recycling items can't be melted down if equipped, unless they're a weapon in your left hand. Items do not show up in the smelters window unless you have the item in question (this includes the vanilla smelt-able dwarven items).

NOTE: Turns out items you enchant CAN be smelted down, I just found that out the hard way. I guess it's because the items you enchant don't have a new item id and the game sees them as normal unenchanted items.

I fallowed derangedhk417's modal of of items giving you less material then they require to craft so

2 Daggers = 1 ingot
1 Sword = 1 ingot
1 Mace = 1 ingot
1 War Axe = 1 ingot
1 Warhammer = 2 ingots
1 Battle Axe = 2 ingots
1 Greatsword = 3 ingots
1 Bow = 2 ingots
30 Arrows = 1 ingot

1 Chest Piece = 3 ingots
1 Gauntlet Set = 1 ingot
1 Boot Set = 2 ingots
1 Shield = 2 ingots
1 helmet = 2 ingots

*Bonemold items do not fallow this mold and instead give you around half the bonemeal needed to make them.
*JaySuS Swords items do not fallow the pattern, they just give you less items then it took to make them.
*You need 30 arrows for one ingot unlike the 10 you needed in Item Recycling.

Dragon, cloth and enchanted items can't be melted down, may be add if requested enugh.

Add's 403 smelting recipes in all.

incompatibility: Item Recycling and possibly other similar mods

Credits derangedhk417 for the original Item Recycling and concept.
author: blackninja50
